sentences.en: At first, he was blissfully unaware of the conspiracy against him.
sentences.cn: 起初，他幸好不知道那些针对他的阴谋。

sentences.en: Detectives have run into a conspiracy of silence in the tight-knit communities of the peninsula.
sentences.cn: 侦探们犯了难，半岛上各个群体抱成一团，达成了保持缄默的密约。

sentences.en: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him.
sentences.cn: 他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。

sentences.en: He is a party to the conspiracy.
He suspects there's a conspiracy to cover up the crime.
sentences.cn: 他怀疑有人密谋掩盖犯罪事实。

sentences.en: He was charged with conspiracy to suborn witnesses.
sentences.cn: 他被指控阴谋收买证人作伪证.

sentences.en: He was mixed up in the conspiracy.
He's charged with conspiracy, misapplication of funds and other crimes.
sentences.cn: 他被控涉嫌阴谋破坏、滥用资金以及其他几项罪行。

sentences.en: It's all part of a conspiracy to dispense with the town centre all together and move everything out to Meadowhall.
sentences.cn: 彻底抛开市中心而把所有东西都搬到梅多霍尔购物中心,这完全是一场阴谋的一部分.

sentences.en: Many people were involved in this conspiracy, but three stand out.
sentences.cn: 很多人参与了这场阴谋，但有3个人是主谋。

sentences.en: Seven men, all from Bristol, admitted conspiracy to commit arson.
sentences.cn: 7个人都来自布里斯托尔，他们承认了合谋纵火。

sentences.en: She was convicted on an indictment for conspiracy.
sentences.cn: 她被控以共谋罪,罪名成立.

sentences.en: The men were found guilty of conspiracy to murder.
sentences.cn: 这些人被裁决犯有阴谋杀人罪.

sentences.en: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.cn: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

sentences.en: They were brought to trial for treasonable conspiracy.
sentences.cn: 他们因密谋叛国被送上法庭。

sentences.en: Those who go in for intrigues and conspiracy are doomed to failure.
sentences.cn: 搞阴谋诡计的人注定要失败.

phrases.tran_cn: 保持缄默协定；攻守同盟

trans.tran_en: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal
